CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 22, 1954, pg. 27, reads: "Uptown Little League Opener - A throng of some five hundred baseball fans saw the North Side Elks down the Pittsburgh Lions by a 1-0 score at Kennard Field, last Saturday, as Jack Bishop's homer decided the issue.  In the above picture (top left) are seen the individual team managers and captains.  Reading, left to right, the managers are, standing: Gary Kenley, behind B. Franklin; T. Harper behind R. Sneed, C. Redwood, behind Billy Weathers; D. M. Jones, behind William Long... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Little League baseball team managers, from left: Gary Kenley, T. Harper, Carl Redwood, D. M. Jones; and players Amvets Post 96 B, Franklin, Pittsburgh Lions R. Sneed, Fireman's Department Store Billy Weathers, and Northside Elks William Long, posed on Kennard Field for Uptown Little League opening day
